section.name: ChatbotEducationTemplate
section.param: A website prospecting bot template to assist your company’s sales, service and marketing.
Hi, I’m {Bot Name}, a digital assistant.
Greet the user and review the pre-chat form, if used.
Hi! I'm FinAid Chatbot, a digital assistant. I'm here to help you with your questions while you fill out your FAFSA form.
What would you like to do?
Let's get you over to an agent who can help.
Thanks for taking the time to chat!
Sorry, I'm still learning, so I'm afraid I couldn't understand that...
Unfortunately, there are no agents available at the moment
Article Answers (Beta) can be used instead of the FAFSA Terms dialog
Unfortunately, a system error occurred. I'll connect you to an agent who can help.
Learn if I qualify for FAFSA
Eligibility dialog per FAFSA conversation experience design document.
OK. You can check your eligibility here: https://fafsa.ed.gov/spa/fafsa4c/#/landing
I can explain financial terms that may be new to you found on the FAFSA form.
What word would you like to learn about?
What word would you like to learn about?
Prompts the user to enter some text when the system variable "[System] Answer Input (Text)" that hold user input is still empty. An example is when the Article Answer is invoked from a menu.
What word would you like to learn about?
Can I assist you with anything else?
Asks the user of anything else before ending the chat. This is where most dialogs redirect to per conversation experience design specs.
Can I assist you with anything else?
Yes - Take me back to the Main Menu
No - I'm all set for now
Get help filling out the FAFSA application
Uses Article Answers to provide answers to questions about the FAFSA application form
OK, what question number on the FAFSA did you want help with?
Your FAFSA form is bound to the academic year you're in. If you start your academic year in August or September, the federal deadline for your FAFSA is the following year on June 30.
You can also find additional information and details about these deadlines on the FAFSA website: https://studentaid.gov/apply-for-aid/fafsa
Would you like to create a calendar reminder for the Federal Deadline?
Alright. Click on the following link to schedule your reminder: https://isvsi-14ddd2ecd93-17863866d4-17a352cf55d.force.com/student/apex/VF_DeadlineCalendarDownload?scode=FD
College FAFSA deadlines are usually early and can differ by school. If you cannot find your college's deadline you should search online for their most up-to-date deadline date.
Which college do you want to check the deadline for?
State deadlines are set by your home state and can vary by state. You can also check all the state deadlines halfway down the page at https://studentaid.gov/h/apply-for-aid/fafsa.
Many states have limited funds, so their FAFSA deadlines may be early. To be considered for the most money, file as early as possible.
What state do you want to check the deadline for?
No, I don't have more deadline questions
OK, no problem. Would you like to learn about how FAFSA deadlines work?

Alright! Here's what you need to know about FAFSA deadlines: The first type of deadline comes from colleges themselves before the academic year starts. To be considered for the most money, you need to submit by the college's deadline.
Checking in: do you have more questions about FAFSA deadlines?
What if I'm applying for FAFSA for multiple colleges?
College FAFSA deadlines are usually early and can differ by school.
When applying to multiple schools, look up each college's due date, find the earliest one, and apply by that date.
Do you have more questions about FAFSA deadlines?
What would you like to do?
